result.execSummary:
The defendant John HER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Methamphetamine as repeater with use of dangerous weapon (<=3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 5+ Yrs)], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: consecutive to sentence serving on 06 CF 430.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with any known drug users or dealers.

supervisions.notes: consecutive to the sentence serving on 06 CF 430.

RE:  Deliver Methamphetamine, on 07-08-14.

At 11:49 a.m., search warrant with return of officer thereon.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of deliver Methamphetamine, possess Methamphetamine with intent to deliver, deliver imitation controlled substance, felon possess firearm, 1st degree recklessly endangering safety, resist officer and fleeing an officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 07-21-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $50,000.00 cash with the condition that he have no contact with Michelle Backus.  Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
